info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 12:57PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Maumee River at Napoleon affecting Henry County.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio...
Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties.
For the Auglaize River...including Fort Jennings, Defiance... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Maumee River...including Fort Wayne, Defiance, Napoleon... Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Maumee River at Napoleon.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flood water will threaten some buildings in the east end of Napoleon and cause several roads to become impassible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:46 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 13.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 15.9 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 700 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
